slog.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to work hard at something without stopping, especially when the work is difficult, tiring, or boring
slog.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Mother slogged all her life for us.
After a day slogging away at work, I need to relax.
You just have to sit down and slog through long lists of new vocabulary.
slog.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to make a long hard journey somewhere, especially on foot
slog.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: He’s been slogging round the streets delivering catalogues.
He started to slog his way up the hill.
slog your way through/round etc something
slog.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a piece of work that takes a lot of time and effort and is usually boring
slog.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: It’ll be a slog, but I know we can do it.
slog.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: a long period of tiring walking
